page.title: 01GENERAL VIEW OF WALSALL
page.content: This block covers the town centre and some of the more outlying areas of {WALSALL}a market town on the northern edge of the industrial{West Midlands. {Rushall}in this block was mentioned in the{Domesday Book}but Walsall although it certainly existed was missed. The town centre is now to the north of{St {Matthews Church}but the old town was grouped closely around the{church on {the hill}that still dominates Walsall. {The Arboretum,}with its lakes in the collapsed limestone workings, is one of the well known features of the town. Another is its{12th Century open air{street market.}Walsall is also famous for its{leather trade}and perhaps doesn't justify its present reputation for being one of the most unhealthy places in Britain.
